channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Ex-US Defense Contractor Executive Jailed for Selling Exploits to Russia
item.description: Peter Williams was sentenced to 87 months in prison for selling cyber exploits to a Russian broker. The post Ex-US Defense Contractor Executive Jailed for Selling Exploits to Russia appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Over 12 Million Users Impacted by CarGurus Data Breach
item.description: Hackers claim to have stolen personally identifiable information and internal corporate data from the automotive firm. The post Over 12 Million Users Impacted by CarGurus Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SecurityWeek Report: 426 Cybersecurity M&A Deals Announced in 2025
item.description: SecurityWeek’s M&A data indicates that today's market is more disciplined, and it seems to favor GRC, data protection, and identity. The post SecurityWeek Report: 426 Cybersecurity M&A Deals Announced in 2025 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Wynn Resorts Confirms Data Breach After Hackers Remove It From Leak Site
item.description: The high-end casino and hotel operator has admitted that employee data was stolen by ShinyHunters. The post Wynn Resorts Confirms Data Breach After Hackers Remove It From Leak Site appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Listen to Earth’s rumbling, secret soundtrack
item.description: The boom of a calving glacier. The crackling rumble of a wildfire. The roar of a surging storm front. They’re the noises of the living Earth, music of this one particular sphere and clues to the true nature of these dramatic events. But as loud as all these things are, they emit even more...

item.title: 3 things Juliet Beauchamp is into right now
item.description: The only reality show that matters The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City is one of the best shows on television right now. Not one of the best reality TV shows, but one of the best TV shows, period. Chronicling a shifting group of wealthy women in and around Salt Lake, the show has featured…

item.title: Now is a good time for doing crime
item.description: Eons ago, in 2012, I had a weird experience. My iPhone suddenly shut down. When I restarted it, I found it was totally reset—clean, like a new device. This was the early days of iOS, so I wasn’t too concerned until I went to connect it to my computer to restore it from a backup.…

item.title: Manual Processes Are Putting National Security at Risk
item.description: Why automating sensitive data transfers is now a mission-critical priority More than half of national security organizations still rely on manual processes to transfer sensitive data, according to The CYBER360: Defending the Digital Battlespace report. This should alarm every defense and government...

item.title: Alibaba Cloud Launches “Ultimate Coding Plan” with Four Top-Tier Open-Source Models
item.description: Alibaba Cloud is redefining AI coding subscriptions by enabling developers to freely switch among multiple top-tier open-source models under a single plan.

item.title: 2026 XPeng X9 All-Electric MPV Set for March 2 Launch: The World’s Longest-Range Seven-Seater EV
item.description: XPeng is set to launch the 2026 all-electric X9, the world’s longest-range seven-seater MPV, combining ultra-fast charging, AI-powered driving, and advanced winter performance.

item.title: Alipay’s “AI Pay” Surpasses 100 Million Active Users, Ushering in the Era of Conversational Shopping
item.description: Alipay’s AI Pay has exceeded 100 million users, demonstrating that conversational, hands-free shopping is becoming mainstream.

item.title: Rsemi Secures Strategic Financing, Focuses on In-Vehicle SerDes and Core Automotive Technologies
item.description: Rsemi secures strategic financing to accelerate development of high-speed in-vehicle SerDes chips and scale its automotive technology offerings.

item.title: AGIBOT Expands into Europe with Germany Launch, Accelerating Localized Robot Deployment
item.description: AGIBOT enters the German market, showcasing a full lineup of humanoid and quadruped robots while partnering with Minth Group to accelerate European deployment.

item.title: Defense Contractor Employee Jailed for Selling 8 Zero-Days to Russian Broker
item.description: A 39-year-old Australian national who was previously employed at U.S. defense contractor L3Harris has been sentenced to a little over seven years in prison for selling eight zero-day exploits to Russian exploit broker Operation Zero in exchange for millions of dollars. Peter Williams pleaded guilty...

item.title: Ad Tech Company Optimizely Targeted in Cyberattack
item.description: The company says the attackers accessed internal business systems such as Zendesk and Salesforce. The post Ad Tech Company Optimizely Targeted in Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: SolarWinds Patches 4 Critical Serv-U 15.5 Flaws Allowing Root Code Execution
item.description: SolarWinds has released updates to address four critical security flaws in its Serv-U file transfer software that, if successfully exploited, could result in remote code execution. The vulnerabilities, all rated 9.1 on the CVSS scoring system, are listed below - CVE-2025-40538 - A broken access...

item.title: CISA Confirms Active Exploitation of FileZen CVE-2026-25108 Vulnerability
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Tuesday added a recently disclosed vulnerability in FileZen to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, citing evidence of active exploitation. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-25108 (CVSS v4 score: 8.7), is a case...

item.title: Multilevel Determinants of Overweight and Obesity Among U.S. Children Aged 10-17: Comparative Evaluation of Statistical and Machine Learning Approaches Using the 2021 National Survey of Children's Health
item.description: arXiv:2602.20303v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Background: Childhood and adolescent overweight and obesity remain major public health concerns in the United States and are shaped by behavioral, household, and community factors. Their joint predictive structure at the population level remains...

item.title: An artificial intelligence framework for end-to-end rare disease phenotyping from clinical notes using large language models
item.description: arXiv:2602.20324v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Phenotyping is fundamental to rare disease diagnosis, but manual curation of structured phenotypes from clinical notes is labor-intensive and difficult to scale. Existing artificial intelligence approaches typically optimize individual components of...

item.title: DMCD: Semantic-Statistical Framework for Causal Discovery
item.description: arXiv:2602.20333v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present DMCD (DataMap Causal Discovery), a two-phase causal discovery framework that integrates LLM-based semantic drafting from variable metadata with statistical validation on observational data. In Phase I, a large language model proposes a...

item.title: Diffusion Modulation via Environment Mechanism Modeling for Planning
item.description: arXiv:2602.20422v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Diffusion models have shown promising capabilities in trajectory generation for planning in offline reinforcement learning (RL). However, conventional diffusion-based planning methods often fail to account for the fact that generating trajectories in...

item.title: Implicit Intelligence -- Evaluating Agents on What Users Don't Say
item.description: arXiv:2602.20424v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Real-world requests to AI agents are fundamentally underspecified. Natural human communication relies on shared context and unstated constraints that speakers expect listeners to infer. Current agentic benchmarks test explicit instruction-following...

item.title: Tensor Network Generator-Enhanced Optimization for Traveling Salesman Problem
item.description: arXiv:2602.20175v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present an application of the tensor network generator-enhanced optimization (TN-GEO) framework to address the traveling salesman problem (TSP), a fundamental combinatorial optimization challenge. Our approach employs a tensor network Born machine...

item.title: MoBiQuant: Mixture-of-Bits Quantization for Token-Adaptive Elastic LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2602.20191v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Changing runtime complexity on cloud and edge devices necessitates elastic large language model (LLM) deployment, where an LLM can be inferred with various quantization precisions based on available computational resources. However, it has been...

item.title: FedAvg-Based CTMC Hazard Model for Federated Bridge Deterioration Assessment
item.description: arXiv:2602.20194v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Bridge periodic inspection records contain sensitive information about public infrastructure, making cross-organizational data sharing impractical under existing data governance constraints. We propose a federated framework for estimating a...

item.title: Controllable Exploration in Hybrid-Policy RLVR for Multi-Modal Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2602.20197v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reinforcement Learning with verifiable rewards (RLVR) has emerged as a primary learning paradigm for enhancing the reasoning capabilities of multi-modal large language models (MLLMs). However, during RL training, the enormous state space of MLLM and...

item.title: IMOVNO+: A Regional Partitioning and Meta-Heuristic Ensemble Framework for Imbalanced Multi-Class Learning
item.description: arXiv:2602.20199v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Class imbalance, overlap, and noise degrade data quality, reduce model reliability, and limit generalization. Although widely studied in binary classification, these issues remain underexplored in multi-class settings, where complex inter-class...

item.title: Talking to Yourself: Defying Forgetting in Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2602.20162v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Catastrophic forgetting remains a major challenge when fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) on narrow, task-specific data, often degrading their general knowledge and reasoning abilities. We propose SA-SFT, a lightweight self-augmentation routine...

item.title: Benchmarking Distilled Language Models: Performance and Efficiency in Resource-Constrained Settings
item.description: arXiv:2602.20164v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Knowledge distillation offers a transformative pathway to developing powerful, yet efficient, small language models (SLMs) suitable for resource-constrained environments. In this paper, we benchmark the performance and computational cost of distilled...

item.title: ConceptRM: The Quest to Mitigate Alert Fatigue through Consensus-Based Purity-Driven Data Cleaning for Reflection Modelling
item.description: arXiv:2602.20166v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In many applications involving intelligent agents, the overwhelming volume of alerts (mostly false) generated by the agents may desensitize users and cause them to overlook critical issues, leading to the so-called ''alert fatigue''. A common strategy...

item.title: InterviewSim: A Scalable Framework for Interview-Grounded Personality Simulation
item.description: arXiv:2602.20294v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Simulating real personalities with large language models requires grounding generation in authentic personal data. Existing evaluation approaches rely on demographic surveys, personality questionnaires, or short AI-led interviews as proxies, but lack...

item.title: What Makes a Good Query? Measuring the Impact of Human-Confusing Linguistic Features on LLM Performance
item.description: arXiv:2602.20300v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Model (LLM) hallucinations are usually treated as defects of the model or its decoding strategy. Drawing on classical linguistics, we argue that a query's form can also shape a listener's (and model's) response. We operationalize this...

item.title: [AINews] The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Closing the Loop
item.description: Through the dozens of midsize launches today (see the rest of the recaps below), one theme that we’re seeing is something I’ve come to call “closing the loop”:

item.title: Just pull a string to turn these tile patterns into useful 3D structures
item.description: MIT researchers have developed a new method for designing 3D structures that can spring up from a flat sheet of interconnected tiles with a single pull of a string. The technique could be used to make foldable bike helmets and medical devices, emergency shelters and field hospitals for disaster...

item.title: A retinal reboot for amblyopia
item.description: In the vision disorder amblyopia (or “lazy eye”), impaired vision in one eye early in life causes neural connections in the brain’s visual system to shift toward supporting the other eye, leaving the amblyopic eye less capable even if the original impairment is corrected. Current interventions...

item.title: Claude Code for Finance + The Global Memory Shortage: Doug O'Laughlin, SemiAnalysis
item.description: A special double pod on the 1 year anniversary of Claude Code: we chat with one of its most vocal fans, who thinks it will write 25-50% of all code on GitHub, plus get a breakdown on the memory crunch

item.title: RoguePilot Flaw in GitHub Codespaces Enabled Copilot to Leak GITHUB_TOKEN
item.description: A vulnerability in GitHub Codespaces could have been exploited by bad actors to seize control of repositories by injecting malicious Copilot instructions in a GitHub issue. The artificial intelligence (AI)-driven vulnerability has been codenamed RoguePilot by Orca Security. It has since been...

item.title: How much does distillation really matter for Chinese LLMs?
item.description: Reacting to Anthropic's post on "distillation attacks."

item.title: Not Just What's There: Enabling CLIP to Comprehend Negated Visual Descriptions Without Fine-tuning
item.description: Vision-Language Models (VLMs) like CLIP struggle to understand negation, often embedding affirmatives and negatives similarly (e.g., matching "no dog" with dog images). Existing methods refine negation understanding via fine-tuning CLIP's text encoder, risking overfitting. In this work, we propose...

item.title: Elevated errors on Claude Sonnet 4.6
item.description: Feb 24, 13:00 UTCUpdate - Previously this incident named Sonnet 4.5 as the affected model. This is a mistake and the model affected is Sonnet 4.6. Sorry.Feb 24, 12:22 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: DANCE: Doubly Adaptive Neighborhood Conformal Estimation
item.description: The recent developments of complex deep learning models have led to unprecedented ability to accurately predict across multiple data representation types. Conformal prediction for uncertainty quantification of these models has risen in popularity, providing adaptive, statistically-valid prediction...

item.title: On the Convergence of Stochastic Gradient Descent with Perturbed Forward-Backward Passes
item.description: We study stochastic gradient descent (SGD) for composite optimization problems with $N$ sequential operators subject to perturbations in both the forward and backward passes. Unlike classical analyses that treat gradient noise as additive and localized, perturbations to intermediate outputs and...

item.title: Elevated errors on Claude Sonnet 4.6
item.description: Feb 24, 07:41 UTCResolved - As of 23:27 PT / 7:27 UTC the errors are back to the baseline.Feb 24, 07:22 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: QEDBENCH: Quantifying the Alignment Gap in Automated Evaluation of University-Level Mathematical Proofs
item.description: As Large Language Models (LLMs) saturate elementary benchmarks, the research frontier has shifted from generation to the reliability of automated evaluation. We demonstrate that standard "LLM-as-a-Judge" protocols suffer from a systematic Alignment Gap when applied to upper-undergraduate to early...

item.title: [AINews] Anthropic accuses DeepSeek, Moonshot, and MiniMax of >16 million "industrial-scale distillation attacks"
item.description: the US-China cold war takes a big step up

item.title: From Performance to Purpose: A Sociotechnical Taxonomy for Evaluating Large Language Model Utility
item.description: As large language models (LLMs) continue to improve at completing discrete tasks, they are being integrated into increasingly complex and diverse real-world systems. However, task-level success alone does not establish a model's fit for use in practice. In applied, high-stakes settings, LLM...

If you experience additional issues or have questions, please open a support case via Snowflake Community or the Support page in...

item.title: Incident with Issues and Pull Requests Search

A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Feb 23, 21:24 UTCUpdate - Some customers are seeing timeout errors when searching for...

item.title: Code search experiencing degraded performance
item.description: Feb 23, 20:33 UTCUpdate - We are continuing to investigate elevated latency and timeouts for code search.Feb 23, 19:59 UTCInvestigating - We are investigating reports of impacted performance for some GitHub services.
